trans-unit.source: Represents an attribute indicating that a service operation is logically an invoke operation and that it can be called by the WCF REST programming model.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is applied to a service operation in addition to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute> and associates the operation with a `UriTemplate` as well as an underlying transport verb that represents an invocation (for example, HTTP POST, PUT, or DELETE).

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is a *passive* operation behavior (the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior> methods do nothing) that adds metadata to the operation description.

Applying the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute to a service operation has no effect unless a behavior that looks for this metadata in the operation description (such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior>) is added to the service's behavior collection.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> determines what HTTP method that a service operation responds to.
By default, all methods that have the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> applied respond to POST requests.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.Method%2A> property allows you to specify a different HTTP method.
If you want a service operation to respond to GET, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> instead.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute"></xref> class.
Gets and sets the body style of the messages that are sent to and from the service operation.
When set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.Bare>, the result of the service operation is written directly to the body of the response message.
Operations that take a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> and return void are handled specially by the formatters.

The formatters do not emit the wrapper name in the response even if <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.BodyStyle%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.Wrapped>.
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.IsBodyStyleSetExplicitly"></xref> property.
This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.
A value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.BodyStyle"></xref> property was set explicitly.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.IsRequestFormatSetExplicitly"></xref> property.
This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.
A value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.RequestFormat"></xref> property was set.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.IsResponseFormatSetExplicitly"></xref> property.
This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.
A value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.ResponseFormat"></xref> property was set.
Gets and sets the protocol (for example HTTP) method the service operation responds to.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.Method%2A> defaults to POST.
The protocol method associated with the operation.
Gets and sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.RequestFormat"></xref> property.
This property determines the format of requests made to a service operation.
The possible values are `Xml` and `Json`.
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets and sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.ResponseFormat"></xref> property.
This property determines the format of responses sent from a service operation.
The possible values are `Xml` and `Json`.
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> enumeration values.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) template for the service operation.
URI templates are used to determine which requests get dispatched to which service operations.
URI templates allow you to map a URI or a set of URIs to a service operation.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] URI templates, see [UriTemplate and UriTemplateTable](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/uritemplate-and-uritemplatetable.md)
The URI template for the service operation.

Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior.AddBindingParameters(System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription,System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection)"></xref> method.
This method does nothing because the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is a passive operation behavior.

Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior.ApplyClientBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation)"></xref> method.
This method does nothing because the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is a passive operation behavior.

Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior.ApplyDispatchBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.DispatchOperation)"></xref> method.
This method does nothing because the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is a passive operation behavior.
Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior.Validate(System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription)"></xref> method.
This method does nothing because the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attribute is a passive operation behavior.
